intro: Baeckea obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. It produces small, pink or white flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Baeckea obtusifolia is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
